meanings.definition: A stone that forms the top of a wall or structure, often slanted to shed water.
meanings.sent1: The copingstone on the wall prevented rain from seeping through.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully placed the copingstone on top of the garden wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the copingstone, pretending to be a king.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the copingstone that held her fragile confidence together.
meanings.sent5: The white copingstone gleamed in the sunlight, a beacon of strength and protection.

meanings.definition: To cover or finish the top of a wall or structure with copingstones.
meanings.sent1: The workers will copingstone the entire perimeter of the building next week.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to copingstone the garden wall during her apprenticeship.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to copingstone their makeshift fort with colorful pebbles.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to copingstone the fragile relationship between the two neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully copingstoned the fountain, adding a touch of elegance to the garden.
